message: So grateful for them all. Our emergency services are being tested now with their hands tied behind their backs. Give these brave men and women the resources they need so they can do the work we need them to do.

And give them a salary they truly deserve. They put their lives on the line every day and yet have to fight the government for a decent pay in contrast we have MPs who give them selves pay rises when they don't deserve.

Absolutely!!!
Emergency services should be paid tenfold more than mps!!
These men and women are true heroes

They are all heroes and should treated as heroes.
Everyone should be knighted for what they have been through.
COME ON GOVERNMENT GIVE THEM A PAY INCREASE THEY DESERVE IT...
Let's hope this government that has done nothing but cut emergency services and ignore residents' pleas for safe, affordable housing get out as soon as possible
Absolutely 100per cent agree. Their jobs are priceless and deserve acknowledging
Agree 100 % . Including the Police as well . They risk their life for our safety. They deserve the pay rise . 👏🏼👏🏼

Not just the gov though Conor Mullins what is the current Mayor doing to overturn some of the ridiculous desicion  which his predecessor made? Mayor Khan has been in office more than a year now and done absolutely nothing to reverse those London closures. None of the political parties take our emergency services seriously just use them as political sticks to hit each other with.
Above all I hope they will all get the help they need to come to terms with what they have witnessed...... I am sure some of them will be suffering from PTDS
What do professional footballers do to warrant the money they get compared to these brave fellas? Oh yeah, kick a ball about on an over sized lawn. Just doesn't make sense!
I agree and pop stars but it's because mugs like us pay vast amounts of money to watch them work. If the same people paid huge amounts of money to watch our heroes work they could then be paid more.!
Couldn't agree more, it's disgusting the amount of Money paid to footballers & pop stars compared to the firefighters
and police officers,working long,long hours,cancelled rest days,for small wages, and I should know
agreed....these professional will never say "i tired boss"!!!
God this comment is stupid. Two completely incomparable professions
Right well you get a travelling crowd of 50000 - 80000 fans buying a ticket to watch em put out the next big blaze, get the merchandise ready and earn them the wage they deserve mush!
Time for our emergency services to be paid a fair wage all the praise in the world won't put food on their tables they are amazing and should be valued by government more.
So true,well said Linda Martin!
Time to get rid of these Transformation services which keep seeing the solution as cutting staff.
Absolutely Gaynor Ellis👌🏽
the company that did the £10m renovations definitely needs investigating. For starters it sounds like a complete rip off. For that price you could have almost built a brand new block.
About 9 million of that budget probably disappeared into the ether.They should def be investigated.
Not even a fire alarm or fire exit/escape installed... definitely something dodgy there...

Rainham essex thats what they did..council i think sold to housing assosiation they built blocks 4 high and the tower came down...my friend lived there many years very run down but im sure it had sprinklers..and each flat had wired in alarms with battery back up
Think not

Why do we moan about the police when we speed or do something else wrong why do young children/teenagers stone the firefighters when they go to put fires out.would you tackle an armed person or run into a building that's on fire?? Probably not so we should all be very grateful to the men and women of our very good British emergency services.

I saw this photo earlier and it broke my heart. I've seen first hand the devastating effect these incidents have on fire fighters. If you know anyone who's been involved with the rescue efforts today please offer them a chat, a coffee, a drink, or just a shoulder to cry on. They've seen things today that no-one should ever have to see.
Well said

I was wondering how THEIR families must have felt as the rescue continued. Many of them are used to it but not on today's standards. They have to wait and hope that their brave loved ones return home and how long before they are back on duty again? I hope they all find peace. Well done.

I've just spoken to a fireman friend who was there yesterday, he said it's the worst thing he's ever seen. No amount of training can prepare you for that. Let's hope they all get rest and support in the coming days.
They are so brave, all our emergency personnel doing what they do. Must be so awful with all those lives lost and what they must have seen. My heart goes out to everyone involved! X
They are all heroes and deserve the resources and salaries to do their incredibly tough and invaluable jobs properly. We are all indebted to them for their selflessness and service. ❤️😪

Yet again, our emergency services personnel have risen to the challenge and stepped up to the mark to do their utmost best for those involved, despite the dangerous conditions they had to endure. Thank you so much!
Really wish to extend my heartfelt thanks for the swift response to this fire cause and for saving the lives of many... Deeply appreciated to our heros ... #OurPrayersAreWithYou #BeSafeEveryone 🙏🙏🙏

Hard enough to watch on a TV..  can't imagine how they cope with the extensive  heat and all the other things a fire of that magnatude involves. They risk their own lives  to save others . They are the true Hero's of society.

Mrs May I hope you are back in England and going to see this after watching the football in Paris. whilst London burns!! These are the heroes that deserve your attention!! Not those overpaid divas kicking a ball about a field for 90mins and getting paid thousands of pounds for doing so. These men are the bravest of the brave, fight and work till the danger is over sometimes for hours not minutes! These are the men and women you and your government (who we elected to do our bidding dont forget and can soon unelect you.) are losing their jobs with your cuts and closures, along with our policeforce the best in the world. We need them all and the NHS and our servicemen and women. Get us a good brexit deal and the money that will not have to be paid into the EU coffers which is corrupt, can be put to use also foreign aid THAT TOO WOULD HELP SAVE OUR HOME ISSUES WHICH YOU LOT ARE PUSHING UNDER THE CARPET. WELL NOT ANYMORE. WE WILL NOT BE FOBBED OFF WITH YOUR CRONIES OF REMAINERS
Well said

Our emergency services in London are being stretched with the terrorist attacks now this fire please Theresa May - give them the pay rise they truly deserve and no more cuts to services for the next decade. They should be applauded by us all brace acts and heroics xx

These r the people that should be on £74,000 a year or more not these Tory government,boris Johnson u should be sacked for shutting fire stations,losing people there jobs,these are our super heros as our doctors,nurses,ambulance staff,all other workers that work for the NHS,u should all hang ur heads in shame
Well said Sharon

Not just the gov though, what is the current Mayor doing to overturn some of the ridiculous desicions  which his predecessor made? Mayor Khan has been in office more than a year now and done absolutely nothing to reverse those London closures. None of the political parties take our emergency services seriously just use them as political sticks to hit each other with. They would all rather sit back and accept the 11% pay rise which all MPs received across all parties whilst the 'colleagues ' in public service received 1%.

The company who refurbished the tower block most likely took all 10 million pounds. There is no way the building had fire protection!!! 
Well done to all emergency services, fire services , police and paramedics

All them mothers who couldn't save there babies,omg how can we comprehend how that feels,.this should never have happened nd should never happen again!we r the majority we have to stand up nd b heard,we can only do that if we stand together xxx

Love and respect to the firefighters, they will be the first to see things that no one would wish to come across, mentally this will live on in their minds and this goes out to all the emergency services!!! True heroes. Keith Harland I may not say it and I do respect what you do and proud of what you do. Xxx
It's the support and love of family that keeps you going. Xxx❤️

If the top football​ players all gave a months pay to the real heros the emergency services would be better off!!  A Huge thank you for All that you do and for putting your life on the line to save others!!

I agree..what contribution is kicking a ball about while London Tower burned? Footballers are nothing in the scheme of things and are paid too much. Life is what is important,  so reward those who protect, mend and cure!

I'm cooking for our local firefighters in Ealing tonight! Bonkers but felt so helpless yesterday I thought this is something I can do. I just called the station and offered. Maybe something you can do to say thank you to yours too. The guy I spoke to said they've been flat out since the fire and are there again today. Feel so proud of them. Go on - feed your firemen!! Xx
Wow! Well done Nas!
Jo Winterbottom Shame they didn't come to mine for dinner 😻😻

Who looks after the 999 crews after something this massive has happened. The hospital staff, ALL of them, not just nurses and DR's, all suffer through this. They are all very professional people but what happens when they all go home at night?
Must be so hard There are patients who get to me and mind have allowed  had full lives and peaceful ends
I've been there, it's pretty awful..
Counselling is available to all and very supportive and understanding families
It's not just the physical demands of the job but the emotional  nd mental traumas they deal with,these ppl r worth there weight in gold ! Don't think I could do wat they do xxx

Looking at the faces of so many firefighters resting before going back to the building and seeing the devastation- it is heartbreaking- they will relive this night after night for a longtime probably wondering if there was something they could have done different ❤️

Their experiences and bravery will have enabled them to bring people to safety but the images they will have witnessed will have left deep trauma. I hope all the emergency services are supported and encouraged to access support for trauma.

The look on this poor guys face says it all.  They live with horrendous sights day in day out and still they come out to help people.  They live with being abused whilst trying to save people, maybe this horrific incident will stop people abusing our emergency services.  Maybe this horrific incident will make the government sit up and take note that we should be increasing our services, not cutting them.  Maybe this horrific incident will make the government realise that all our emergency services should be paid for what they do.  Maybe all these footballers on obscene salaries and the football clubs paying them should take note and realise that they do not deserve this kind of obscene money.  If the club's have that kind of money to throw around, throw it in the direction of those who have lost everything.

Thankfully they all have access to counselling etc these days. 
Unfortunately for my dad and all the old crews they just had to get on and deal with it. 
It's nice to, at last, see the emergency services get the recognition they deserve. 
Also spare a thought for the families these guys and gals go home too......
I learnt very early on to give my dad space and quiet after a particularly bad shout

They are beautiful human being 
I saw them at 7am exhausted and waiting to save more people. There were approx 14 fire brigade trucks, hundreds of fire brigade staff exhausted as they were trying to save people from 1am last night. Local people brought them food and water.
Yes but usually they are fed and watered in bed in the station whilst paramedics have no such luxury.

Can't believe u have just said that that is of no consequence when they risk their lives to save others how petty you r would u do what they do. I have the upmost respect for the fireman going into a burning building and to all the ambulance and police.
For your information most brigade stations if they want to eat see to themselves as most services do

Our society is packed with unheralded heroes—small-town physicians, teachers in poverty-stricken neighborhoods, people who work in dirty, dangerous jobs like coal-mining to support a family. A firefighter plunging into a burning house to retrieve a frightened, smoke-blinded  child of course is a hero. But let's be careful to save  the encomiums (especially the word "hero") for when they are truly deserved,  and not when they just show up to do their job.
We hear the word "hero" thrown about weekly in regard to the emergency services when on most occasions they are doing a job they are trained for and paid to do.
My dad was a firefighter and trust me, these guys are definitely heroes!
They are all HERO'S!!!
So one should automatically herald every firefighter a hero just for being a firefighter
Caius Williams
What Tav Westwood
Dan chill out
I hope the Evening Standard never has the gall to criticize Firefighters again if they have to take industrial action to try and defend jobs and services or, God forbid, seek a pay rise.

To our public services, I love you and thank you for your compassion and dedication. You are heroes and thank you! I ❤️you Great Britain. We have been through a lot as a nation. May our God comfort us as we choose to carry on, united in the midst of all this. Great Britain, mother to world nations. I adore you.  You are magnificent, beautiful and Strong. You continue to show the world that you are indestructible. Hence, you chose to stand alone and just love and embrace all world nations without prejudice. Proud to be British and I am grieving from Hampshire, in solidarity with the nation.  My Sincere condolences and deep sympathy for all directly impacted. I love you all , best wishes ❤️and RIP to lost souls💔😭❤️

And what a horrible task awaits them looking for the ones that perished in the fire. May they find the strength to do it and may all those who have died rest in peace. And YES why have all the public services been treated so  badly, firefighters, the police force ambulance crews, nurses and all health workers have not had pay rise for years. Yet they are always there when we need them and we have seen how tirelessly they work. We shouldn't take them for granted and yes they all deserve a pay rise and further resources so they can continue to do such a good job.
Thank you to all our amazing services they are wonderful they risk their lives and also save lives they are my heroes they all deserve a better wage for what they do love them all xx
So very true they deserve so very much for the job they do true heroes xxx

Totally agree!!! But is this the same London evening standard that is now s mouthpiece for the tories ran by a guy who supported cuts to the very emergency services that this article speaks of!!! Words are cheap they need actions

It's not "selfless" service they do. 
They get paid for it.  Selfless means you get nothing in return. 
Want to see "selfless service" (Sewa) look at Sikhs. 

However they are very brave Heroes who are bringing out the victims from burning building. We salute them.
They don't get paid enough for it.
Anna Hall  I can agree with this mate.
Where would we be without our wonderful emergency services......some of the best in the world, my thanks and gratitude to you all. Let's hope the government feels the same.

Our fireman, police and paramedics are the best in the world. They are selfless heros that go out not knowing what's waiting for them on call. But they do their job to the best of their abilities. We are so lucky that we live in a society that has that attitude. Thank you for doing a fantastic job.

Emergency services all put there lives on the line when they do there job's  but the Government make cuts after cuts the men and women of all our Emergency services should be well pay hoo know Mrs May you might need there HELP ONE DAY very proud of you ALL THANK YOU

So, so proud of all of our emergency services. Thank you for your selfless dedication. You have your own families at home, but still do not flinch from putting yourselves at risk to help others. Our heartfelt admiration and love for your courage. We can never thank you enough. Xxxx
This is so sad Jo.  The firefighters were such heroes. Terrified to hear how many more have died. BBC was reporting people posting pictures and messages of missing loved ones.

Amazing men and women  they all deserve a knighthood not the pen pushers in Whitehall. The government  should hold their head in shame... council cutbacks and pay freezes for these outstanding public services. So proud if you all
London's emergency services have made Londoners proud once again. You are the wonderful bunch - the best in the world.
So amazing are our fire fighters along with our police who have had to face  horrendous atrocities in these last few weeks, respect to each and everyone of them.

Our Wonderful BRAVE​ fireman NHS Police thank you The Wonderful people the kindness the love that has been shown to one another all coming together in confusion and sadness and grief a lot where strangers yesterday but today close friends helping one another to stay strong all HERO'S
Thank you. You are brave courageous heroes. I would always want you on my side and be there for my beloved family. May All the Gods bless you. X
I'm crying x
After all the tragedy that our country has seen recently I am so thankful for our emergency services. Makes me very proud to be British.
These brave men and women save lives everyday it's shameful that it takes a tragedy for them to receive recognition for what they do. Total respect now and always
I cannot even begin to imagine. They are so brave. Well done to all those who stepped in and saved lives. So much courage xx
The firefighters are going to have images in their heads that won't ever go away, this will affect all their lives, so much respect goes out to them and what they do.

Londons emergency services have done the city proud recently, despite being stretched to breaking point. I will never fathom why this government has specifically targeted them and stripped them to the bone.

Because they are an easy target. ...a dedicated bunch of lads and lassies who do the job for what ever reason....certainly not the money, l don't know why!!!!. My eldest has been doing it for 21+ years, pretty sure he was involved in the " incident " as he was on duty at Fulham F/S at
 the time of the shout. The "lads" I think do what they do knowing that their colleagues will be there their  for their families when needed. THANK YOU ALL an god bless. ...

Why oh why do we treat them like pariahs until there is a disaster?  Someone dear to me has a chemical nuclear and biological suit. It will be very useful if she has to drive in over fifty miles to use it.
They are superb, and we owe them more than we will ever know. please God they will get through the horrors of what they are having to deal with.
Thank you isn't enough for al the services bravery , my heart goes out to them all. Cannot imagine what they've had to face today x
I would like to thank all of our emergency services well done for today and I hope you get the support yo will need after today x

They need more money and more Fire stations and more firemen.That goes for the Police aswell and our NHS.All our self serving MPs with these cut backs have ruined this country.And we do have the money.FACT.
The fire brigade need oxygen masks to enter building. I hear firemen are breathing smoke.. This will save lives.
And that's the trouble with the Tories; they don't consider our everyday heroes in all our services are worth more than some fatcat CEO !!
Don't report this too soon. Eye witnesses are saying the fire brigade arrived late and told people to stay in the building. Any idiot knows you should try to get out of a burning building asap.
First Pump got there within 8 mins of call FACT!  What were you doing at 0100 this morning?  Geeez

Get your facts right, they were there within 10 mins and it was actually the signs in the building that advised people to stay in their homes. 
The men and women of the fire brigade are hero's, that is a fact.
Arrived late?? Don't talk rubbish. They are all highly trained and know exactly what they are doing!
It wasn't the fire brigade that told them to stay put! It was the tenant management company!
8 min is a fact ! Where do you get ur Iformation from please tell ?
Kate Denholm I know the Tenant Management Company did, but don't the fire brigade have a loud speaker system they could have told people to leave?
Boris Johnson closed 3 nearby fire stations when mayor
It was actually six minutes as reported by the Fire Commissioner yesterday. The building also had a 'stay put' policy in the event of a fire.
Have always thought they're brilliant. Yet, the government want to increase their retirement age. A 60 year old doing the job is ridiculous.
Total heroes.  They still have hearts, feelings but put their lives at risk every day for us. Enormous respect to them all x
Whoever guilty for causing the terrible tragedy shd be done for murder cos end of day they've murdered innocent people the residents raised major concerns bout building and nil done.
Corporate manslaughter.  Someone needs to be held accountable.
Yes i agree

Heros without a doubt . Plus ambulance staff doctors n nurses,n air ambulance ,police ..well done ,n thank you , so sad , out thoughts n prayers go out to all the family's on there loss , n those injured .tragic ,,,,,

Give all the emergency services the resources, respect and support they need. Theresa may and her government know nothing about how hard they work on a wage they can't even afford to buy a house with in this city!
Respect is the word politicians have forgotten if someone put our guardian angels first (emergency services,) they would get 100 percent vote
Id like to see a gofundme set up for all those firefighters who deserve a huge pat on the back and a decent bonus as the Government won't. These heroes also deserve a reward.

Thank you to all the brave men and women from the fire service and other emergency services for being there today and always. What would we do without you. You make Britain Great. Blessings to each and every one of you.

They all deserve the highest praise . No one can imagine the terrible things they saw , but they went back into that inferno time and time again . No thought to their own danger . Everyone a hero and I , for one , am extremely grateful to them for all they did .
You don't need words do you, just this picture tells how devastating this is for the firefighters involved and how exhausted they must be. They all deserve to be treated like heros.

God bless them all. The horror of what they have witnessed will stay with them forever. If I hear another Tory politicians say thank you to our emergency services and then tell them they are not needed or valuable to pay properly I will scream.

God bless.... but please forgive me if I put this forward acknowledging all the brave firefighters n relevant emergency responders but are they  given enough support in terms of manpower equipment machineries etc to tackle high rise buildings in this beautiful city London - is there airborne like helicopters or anything else that can help in rescue and in fire fighting if (god forbid) there should be anymore emergency considering theres 4000 older towers 😔 my prayers condolences & thoughts

Is this fire fighter rubbing his eyes because hes tired after an horrendous shift, the smoke is hurting his eyes or is he rubbing his eyes because hes crying because of what hes experienced, I would imagine its all of those things. This is what fire fighters  put themselves through in the line of duty. Hero's indeed

These men never have a thought to themselves. It must have been horrific for them too. They watched people desperately crying for help and couldn't get to them all. The fire travelled so fast and high they tried helplessly to get people out. They saved as many as they could. How do you think they will feel about so many killed. For them too they will have horrific memories of the people they couldn't reach in time. They did their very best in an impossible situation. God bless all of these people who have tried to help the homeless, devastated people who have lost their families x

There was a photo of a firefighter at 9/11 that summed up their work. He was covered in dust etc. I still have that. Please could you make available the one of the fireman dousing himself with water available as a symbol of this recent catatstrophe. Thankyou. Cannot save it on my phone.
God bless these heroes.  this government need to be ashamed of themselves.  These people should be payed alot more than they are. They put their own lives at risk to save others.  💙💙
Thank goodness for our wonderful, fire fighters, health service, police, You are all hero's. Our thoughts  are with all the families  that have suffered, so very sad,❤xx
The governments around the world should be looking at this and shuddering in their shoes, as there are hundreds of buildings like this and a a nightmear..so sad
All your  emergency  services  do a brilliant  job and deserve  a decent wage  they should be  valued by your government  more
Police, firefighters and emergency services including doctors and nurses. You are heroes! 🌹

Such brave and selfless guys. They are amazing and I for one are so grateful that we have services like this. Thank you with all my heart. xxxxxx
The government need to recognise that they need support and not cutbacks.
THANKYOU to ALL the Firefighters for doing such a Dangerous Job yesterday And other days too.  Xxxxx❤❤❤❤  l don't live in London but you are Soooo appreciated.
Amazed and in awww of these brave men and women. They live with what happens and what they see. Thank for your quick response. I would hug each and every one of you if I could

My heart breaks. For the victims and can't stop thinking about the heroes
Who have to go to work.   Not knowing what!!!!!!!!

From a retired fire service station officer I know the bravery and dedication by the crews that attended this horrific incident . I have seen much in my service but this was the worst I have ever seen.
It should never had happened. Fire security had never been a priority with Councils. Will they pay attention now?
In a compassionate world they'd get a bonus this year (on top of any pay rise). Because of their exemplary attitudes they'd probably decline it.
They do an amazing job, and we so often take it all for granted. All our emergency services were and are brilliant. Let's all be thankful for them.
Much love and respect to these brave firefighters from across the pond.
These are the true heroes that kids should look up to not the footballers pop stars and actors and they probably pay their taxes aswell
Why haven't they had a pay rise for 8 years , the government should be ashamed 😡
God Bless the Firemen and Firewomen indeed!  It truly takes a special kind of person to head straight into peril to save others!
Freeze MPs' pay for a decade if not more and give all emergency services pay rises. #braveeveryday

Our True Superheroes 😘
You deserve so much more.....
No more Austerity.......
Thank you a hundred thousand times for all the help you gave, trying to save lifes!
The courage, professionalism and dedication of our country's emergency services are an inspiration. God Bless every one of them.

God bless the fire fighters ,ambulance police andanyone 
Who tried to help
God bless our firemen and women NHS staff, Police persons for there bravery and selfless acts today ❤️❤️❤️
What a great job LFB have done. If anyone should be on 100 grand a week look no further. Not footballers.
Totally agree Mark, they are all complete heroes in my eyes x
Thank you on behalf of every ungrateful people who do not realise the fantastic job you do.
Questions need to be asked about the company and products used in the refurb. This should never have happened
Heard they were working 12 hour shifts instead of four hour shifts because of cuts.
Wonderful firefighters.god bless you all.Thinking of all the poor people xx
Sian Summer think 2nd pic in this article is your dad xx
Dad wasn't there, we all had to week off so we've been in Cornwall xx
Eternal Gratitude, Salutes,  to each one of you , our Superheroes.
Everyone is so proud of you Carl Ramsay  and all of the emergency services that attended. Xx
Well done to the crews of  London Fire & Rescue service, you have our utmost admiration.
Well done all the emergency  services  so proud  of you  all
Hero's everyone one of them. To think they do this all their life without reservation.
I bet they've had the worst night of their lives bless them 💕💕💕
It's time the government up the public services wages in stead of wasting it on cutting corners just like they did on that tower block 😠
Another Tragedy  just heartbreaking . And once again All the Emergency Services pushed to the limit & giving 110% you are truly amazing each & everyone of you . 😔
Thought they were cutting the fire services, this clearly shows we need more of the emergency services.
Thank you to ALL that helped the victims from the firemen to nurses to doctors to volunteers.....
Much respect to the firemen who risk their lives in the line of duty to save lives. You are heroes.
These guys are complete heroes! They deserve a medal, and more. Where would we be without them. Total admiration and respect
London's emergency services are heroic and working hard these weeks....They deserve every support
God bless our Heroes firemen police paramedics,they are the best in the world ❤️
Wonderful brave firefighters,thank you so much for the job you all do.
much respect, they are true heroes!
Norman Bridges. Oxygen is part of the fire triangle. Don't fancy one on my back. Compressed air is what we use.
They are ALL Heroes where would we be without them.Amazing people!
This is a very tragic event... I don't have words to express myself ...
God bless them for the amazing work they do  they deserve the respect of everyone
I can't and don't really want to, imagine the scene!!!Nevermind  the heat!!! They are definitely heroes in my book 💝
Ian Moore and David Bryan looks like pics of you in this article?
Yet the mayor  is going  to charge  all emergency services  for using  the congestion zones,  unless  they spend millions  on updating  their  vehicles
My heart goes out to them all. What a job they do. Absolute angels
All emergency services have been absolutely wonderful x
They see and deal with situations no person should see. They deserve a medal xx
Well  let us praise the fire fighters  and thank them for all their effort  to  saving lives even when  they put their lives at risk
One Fire Fghter said...you know it's serious when they tell you to write your name on your safety helmet before entering the 'burning block' very brave people.👩‍🚒👩‍🚒
What a courages team deserve credit putting  their own lifes at risk to save others
Such a sad day for the people of London as the emergency services are tested once again but truly heroic in my eyes
What an absolute tragedy, so many people lost or injured.
This photo says it all!! Where would we be without these men and women.......❤️
Yes they well deserve a pay rise now  and many years a go heroes always xx
Yes totally agreexx my hat goes off to you allxx such a brave job you guys do so a massive big thank youxxx🤗
Incidents like this demonstrate how amazing our emergency services are. Pity this government don't treat them better.
Labour want to get in with minority vote - let them in, instead of the farce we have with May and DUP. Labour know what we need and we need it now
Tireless, forcassed, dedicated r a few words to describe these heroes. Bless them.
They are all heroes who risk their lives every day. Give them the pay rise and respect they richly deserve.
Absolute hero's amazing people as we know we all have feelings hearts go out to all family s x x

Greetings and prayers from Germany!
This firefighters are heroes, god bless them and their families!
Amen, Lord God just bless these people in ur mighty name of Jesus.

To all of our Wonderful Emergency Service Staff.
Thank you.  Thank you. Thank you. We are so lucky to have you and we are so grateful for your Bravery. God Bless you All.
They are our true heroes!! They are truly amazing we are so grateful to them all!! ❤️
Praise indeed, no words at all can describe how brave and courageous!!! X
So grateful to you all brave loving men and women God Bless you all love Sally xxxx
We used to live round the corner from this area back in the 80's Glenda. So sad so very very sad.
Heartbreaking...woke up again to anoother tragedy. Pleae let it finish.
True heroes.  I hope they realise how grateful we all are to them.
Yes all fireman should be thanked for what they are doing in londen  and in south Africa with the fires in knysna and pe

Baz I so agree and they should be paid more not have their pay frozen
God bless all the emergency services they are the best in the world😊😊

Thank You To All Our Brave Firefighters. Government hang your head in SHAME. .
THE TRAGIC EVENTS OF RECENT WEEKS HAVE SHOWN OUR EMERGENCY SERVICES ARE THE BEST IN THE WORLD.THESE HEROS DESERVE A DECENT PAY RISE,AND RECOGNITION FOR WHAT THEY DO.
